docs.title: SD-WAN Lab Centralized and Localized Policies
Speakers
docs.text:
• Lei Tian Customer Delivery Architect, Cisco CX
  • Oscar Eduardo Desentis Clemente Customer Delivery Architect, Cisco CX

docs.title: Learning Objectives
docs.text:
Upon completion of this lab, you will be able to :

  • Use localized policy to deploy OSPF policy

  • Use localized policy to deploy QoS policy

  • Use centralized policy to deploy a Hub & Spoke Topology

  • Use centralized policy to deploy Application Aware Routing

docs.title: Catalyst SD-WAN Manager
docs.text: Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager provides centralized configuration, management, operation, and monitoring across the entire SD-WAN fabric. You will comeplte all lab tasks using Catalyst SD-WAN Manager.

docs.title: Localized Policy Oveview
docs.text:
Localized policies are deployed and enforced locally on SD-WAN Edge devices. There are two type of localized policies.

  • Localized Control Policy

  • Localized Data Policy

In this lab, you wil deploy OSPF localized control policy and QoS localized data policy using Catalyst SD-WAN Manager.

docs.title: Centralized Policy Overview
docs.text:
Centralized policy is policy applied to the whole SD-WAN fabric. Centralized policies are deployed on SD-WAN Controllers. Depends on the type of policy, enforcement of centralized policy can be either on SD-WAN controller or on SD-WAN Edge devices. There are two type of centralized policies.

  • Centralized Control Policy

  • Centralized Data Policy

In this lab, you will deploy Hub & Spoke centralized control policy and AAR centralized Data Policy using Catalyst SD-WAN Manager.

docs.title: Task 1 Localized OSPF Policy
docs.text:
In this task, you are going use localized route policy to set OSPF metrics, and another route policy block default route.

  1. In Site 300, OSPF is pre-configured between core router Site300-Core-VPN10 and Site300-cE1 on service side. Mutual redistribution beteen OMP and OSPF is also enabled.

  2. Verify the OSPF neighbor by navigate to Monitor > Devices > Site300-cE1 > Real Time > OSPF Neighbors

  1. Verify local route 131.131.131.0/24 is installed as OSPF route into the VPN 10 routing table. Navigate to Monitor > Devices > Site300-cE1 > Real Time > IP Route

  1. Verify omp route 131.131.131.0/24 is installed on remote site. Navigate to Monitor > Devices > Site400-cE1 > Real Time > IP Route

  1. Verify omp routes being redistributed into OSPF and installed on Site300-Core-VPN10

    a. open mRemoteNG from jumphost's desktop

    b. select Site300-Core-VPN10 from the pre-configured Putty session

docs.title: Note: If you don't see pre-configured connections, check View-Connections
docs.text:
c. Login with username:cisco & password:cisco. Run command show ip route

Note the redistributed routes are seen as E2 routes with default metric

  1. Add a Route Policy to set the OSPF metric of 1000 for prefixes redistributed from OMP a. Navigate to Configuration > Policies > Custom Options > Localized Policy > Route Policy

b. Route Policy VIP18-Route-Policy is pre-configured to set OSPF metric to 1000. Click the ... to view the policy setting.

c. To add the route policy into configuration. Navigate to Configuration > Policies > Localized Policy , select pre-configured policy Site300-Local-Policy-v1 and Click the ... ti Edit the policy.

d. Select Route Policy then select Add Route Policy and Import Existing

e. Select VIP18-Route-Policy from Policy drop-down, then Import

f. Click Save Policy Changes to push configuration Site300-cE1-v1

g. Now, let's apply the Route Policy to OSPF. Navigate to Configuration > Templates > Feature Templates

h. Search feature template VIP18-OSPF-Neighbor and select Edit

i. Under REDISTRIBUTE section, click the Pencil icon to update omp redistritbuion setting

j. Select Global from drop-down of Route Policy, and configure VIP18-Route-Policy.

Note Make sure to enter the name correctly

k. Save the template change and push configuration to Site300-cE1

docs.title: Lab Topology
docs.text:
The lab topology includes:

  • On-prem controllers : One vManage, one vBond, and two vSmart

  • Two central locations (Hub/DC) with redundant routers

  • Two regular branch locations

  • One regular branch location with redundant routers

  • MPLS and Internet connectivity per site

  • DCI connectivity between central locations

  • Three VPN/VRF segments: corporate (VPN 10), IoT/PCI (VPN 11) and Guest (VPN 12)
